post.summary:
Get aggregated numeric measurements by measurement path. A maximum of 10000 measurements are returned.
Requesting the endpoint with a empty filter will return measurements from the last seven days most failed steps
post.description:
Split sequence steps with the paragraph mark - ¶
ex. MainSequence Callback¶NI steps (NI seq call)¶Multiple Numeric Limit Test

Measurement name must be specified for multi numeric measurements. In those cases, simply prepend the measurement name with two paragraph marks.
ex. MainSequence Callback¶NI steps (NI seq call)¶Multiple Numeric Limit Test¶¶Measurement0

Separate multiple paths with semi colon (;)
ex.
MainSequence Callback¶NI steps (NI seq call)¶Multiple Numeric Limit Test¶¶Measurement0;MainSequence Callback¶NI steps (NI seq call)¶Multiple Numeric Limit Test¶¶Measurement1


partnumber and testOperation filter required

post.summary: PREVIEW - Calculate repair statistics by custom dimensions.
post.description:
Please note that this endpoint is in preview and may be a subject to changes.

Repair statistic calculated by custom dimensions defined in the dimensions filter. Multiple values are separated with semicolon (;).

```
Supported dimensions: 

partNumber, revision, productName, productGroup, unitType, repairOperation, period, level, stationName, location, purpose, 
operator, miscInfoDescription, miscInfoString, repairCode, repairCategory, repairType, componentRef, componentNumber, 
componentRevision, componentVendor, componentDescription, functionBlock, referencedStep, referencedStepPath,
testOperation, testPeriod, testLevel, testStationName, testLocation, testPurpose, testOperator,
batchNumber, swFilename, swVersion
```

The result is ordered by the order specified. Direction may be specified with direction hints (asc or desc).


You may order the result by repair kpis        

```
Supported kpis: 
repairReportCount, repairCount
```


Default filter:

Top 10 partNumber/repairOperation combinations from the last 30 days.

```
{ 
"topCount":10,
"periodCount":30,
"dateGrouping":1,
"includeCurrentPeriod":true,
"dimensions" : "repairCount desc;repairReportCount desc;partNumber;repairOperation" 
}
```

parameters.name: dimensions
parameters.description:
Supported values: 
             partNumber, revision, productName, productGroup, unitType, repairOperation, period, level, stationName, location, purpose, 
             operator, miscInfoDescription, miscInfoString, repairCode, repairCategory, repairType, componentRef, componentNumber, 
             componentRevision, componentVendor, functionBlock, referencedStep, referencedStepPath,
             testOperation, testPeriod, testLevel, testStationName, testLocation, testPurpose, testOperator,
             batchNumber, swFilename, swVersion

post.summary: PREVIEW - Calculate yield by custom dimensions.
post.description:
Please note that this endpoint is in preview and may be a subject to changes.

Kpis are calculated by custom dimensions defined in the dimensions filter. Multiple values are separated with semicolon (;).

```
Supported dimensions: 
partNumber, productName, stationName, location, purpose, revision, testOperation, processCode, swFilename, swVersion,
productGroup, level, period, batchNumber, operator, fixtureId, socketIndex, errorCode, miscInfoDescription, miscInfoString,
stepCausedUutFailure, stepPathCausedUutFailure, assetSerialNumber, assetName
```

The result is ordered by the order specified. Direction may be specified with direction hints (asc or desc).


You may order the result by kpis (except for the trend and previous columns).
Only requested kpis are returned (all kpis are returned if none are specified).

```
Supported kpis: 
unitCount, fpCount, spCount, tpCount, lpCount, fpy, spy, tpy, lpy, testYieldCount,
testReportCount, testYield, firstUtc, lastUtc, fpFailCount, spFailCount, tpFailCount, lpFailCount, retestCount,
ppmFpy, ppmSpy, ppmTpy, ppmLpy, ppmTestYield,
fpColor,fpAlarm,fpWarning,spColor,spAlarm,spWarning,tpColor,tpAlarm,tpWarning, lpColor, lpAlarm, lpWarning, tyColor, tyAlarm, tyWarning, 
previousUnitCount, previousTestReportCount, fpyTrend, spyTrend, tpyTrend, lpyTrend, unitCountTrend, fpCountTrend, spCountTrend, tpCountTrend, 
lpCountTrend, testReportCountTrend, testYieldCountTrend, testYieldTrend, 
ppmFpyTrend, ppmSpyTrend, ppmTpyTrend, ppmLpyTrend, ppmTestYieldTrend
```


Default filter:

Top 10 partNumber/testOperation combinations from the last 30 days.

```
{ 
"topCount":10,
"periodCount":30,
"dateGrouping":1,
"includeCurrentPeriod":true,
"dimensions" : "unitCount desc;partNumber;testOperation" 
}
```
            

More information about yield calculations can be found here: [Statistics and calculations in WATS](https://usermanual.wats.com/2022.1/default.htm#!Documents/statisticsandcalcula.htm)

parameters.name: dimensions
parameters.description:
Supported values: 
             partNumber, productName, stationName, location, purpose, revision, testOperation, processCode, swFilename, swVersion,
             productGroup, level, period, batchNumber, operator, fixtureId, socketIndex, errorCode, miscInfoDescription, miscInfoString,
             stepCausedUutFailure, stepPathCausedUutFailure, assetSerialNumber, assetName

vendorBinding:  0 = required, 1 = optional, 2 = never

get.summary: Returns a list of assets matching the specified filter.
get.description:
This method supports OData query options such as the $filter, $top or $orderby query parameters.
Returns top 1000 assets unless the $top query parameter have been specified with another value (e.g. $top=1).
Results are always ordered by assetId, unless the $orderby query parameter has been specified otherwise.

Examples:

Restrict to a certain asset:
https://your-server-address/api/Asset$filter=assetId eq '1'

Assets belonging to a certain asset type:
https://your-server-address/api/Asset?$filter=typeId eq FC48E41D-6276-4BF0-83F2-FA8AF9AAB91A

Most recently created asset:
https://your-server-address/api/Asset?$top=1&$orderby=firstSeenDate desc

All assets exceeding its running count limit:
https://your-server-address/api/Asset?$filter=runningCount gt 1000

put.summary:
Create or update an asset.

Properties such as 'runningCount' and 'totalCount' must be updated using appropriate API methods (e.g. api/Asset/Count).

Properties such as 'lastCalibrationDate' and 'lastMaintenanceDate' must be updated using appropriate API methods (e.g. api/Asset/Calibration).

The 'assetId' property can be left empty.

The 'typeId' property must be specified. Use the 'typeId' of the desired asset type (see: api/Asset/Types).

requestBody.description: The asset to create, or the updated asset

delete.summary:
Delete the asset which has the specified identifier.

Log records for the asset will also be deleted.

Any assets which has the asset as parent will not be deleted, but will change parent.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Asset ID

parameters.name: serialNumber
parameters.description: Asset serial number

parameters.name: assetId
parameters.description: Asset ID

Use 'totalCount' or 'incrementBy' query parameters to increment the running count and total count.

parameters.name: incrementChildren

parameters.name: cultureCode
parameters.description: Translate the 'message' string to the specified culture (e.g. zh-CN for Chinese)

get.summary: Returns a list of asset log records matching the specified filter.
get.description:
This method supports OData query options such as the $filter, $top or $orderby query parameters.
Returns top 1000 logs unless the $top query parameter have been specified with another value (e.g. $top=1).

Results are always ordered by descending by log date/time (UTC), unless the $orderby query parameter has been specified otherwise.

Examples:

Log records for a certain asset:
https://your-server-address/api/Asset/Log?$filter=assetId eq '1'

Certain type of log records for an asset (e.g. asset update records only):
https://your-server-address/api/Asset/Log?$filter=assetId eq '1' and type eq 2

Type can be:
0 = Message
 
1 = Register (Asset created)

2 = Update (Asset property updated)

3 = Reset count (Running count has been reset in Asset Manager)

4 = Calibration (Asset has been calibrated)

5 = Maintenance (Asset has had maintenance)

This method supports OData query options such as the $filter, $top or $orderby query parameters.
Returns top 1000 types unless the $top query parameter have been specified with another value (e.g. $top=1).
Results are always ordered by name, unless the $orderby query parameter has been specified otherwise.

Examples:

Restrict to a certain asset type:
https://your-server-address/api/Asset/Types?$filter=typeName eq 'Fixture'

Asset types requiring calibration each 30 days:
https://your-server-address/api/Asset/Types?$filter=calibrationInterval eq 30

get.summary:
Creat and return a new access token (identified by the authenticated user).
 
 You will get access to the WATS API by specifying the Authorization header together with the returned token.
 
 The token is visible only once, please store it secure. 
 
 Specify the reset flag to create a new token (the old one is no longer valid).

‏‏‎ ‎

 Ex.
 Authorization: Basic ReturnedToken

Creat and return a new access token with a specific identifier
 
 You will get access to the WATS API by specifying the Authorization header together with the returned token.
 
 The token is visible only once, please store it secure.
 
 Specify the reset flag to create a new token (the old one is no longer valid).

‏‏‎ ‎

 Ex.
 
 Authorization: Basic ReturnedToken

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Token identifier

post.summary:
Queue a background export job exporting UUT certificates.

You will receive an email with a download link when the export is done. When using a token to authenticate, the export has to be downloaded by the same token. The link in the email will only work for the user or token that queued the export.

Alternatively, you can periodically poll GET api/Export/List and wait for the returned exportFileName to be in the list, then download the zip from GET api/Export/{filename}.

parameters.name: headerDataOnly
parameters.description: If export should only contain header data, or step data as well.

parameters.name: asIndividualFiles
parameters.description: If reports should be individual PDFs in a zip or one big PDF in a zip.

parameters.name: dimensions
parameters.description:
Which details to include, separated by semicolon. Can also be specified in WATS filter. Supported values: 
            stationData, miscInfo, subUnitInfo, asset, batchNumber, executionTime, testSocketIndex, operator, errorCode, errorMessage, fixtureId, testOperation, reportStatus, 
            comment, swFilename, swVersion, stepStatus, stepTime, measurement, units, compOperator, lowLimit, highLimit, viewStepHierarchy, signCertificate, xyGraph, pageNumbers

parameters.name: numericFormat
parameters.description:
Default numeric format to use when a number does not have a format defined in the report. Supported values:
            default, integer, decimal, scientific, general, hexadecimal, binary

parameters.name: bodyFooterTag
parameters.description: Find Product based on part number and use the value for this tag as footer text.

parameters.name: documentFooterTag
parameters.description: Find Product based on part number and use the value for this tag as document footer text.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email to send download link to when the export is done. Required when using a token. Can be omitted when authenticating with a user (uses the users registered email).

post.summary: Create a parent/child relation between two units.
post.description:
Create a parent/child relation between two units.


There are several validation rules:
- The child unit must not already have a parent.
- The parent unit's box build must define the child unit as valid. Alternatively the {checkPartNumber} and {checkRevision} parameters can be provided to override the part number and revision the child unit is validated against.
- The child unit must be in phase Finalized, or its ProductRevision has the PhaseFinalized tag and the unit is in the specified phase. Example: PhaseFinalized tag = In Storage and unit Phase = In Storage is valid.
- The relation cannot create a loop of parent/child relations.

parameters.name: parentSerialNumber
parameters.description: The serial number of the unit that will be the parent.

parameters.name: parentPartNumber
parameters.description: The part number of the unit that will be the parent. Optional if you ensure units have unique serial numbers across all products.

parameters.name: childSerialNumber
parameters.description: The serial number of the unit that will be the child.

parameters.name: childPartNumber
parameters.description: The part number of the unit that will be the child. Optional if you ensure units have unique serial numbers across all products.

parameters.name: checkPartNumber
parameters.description: Leave blank to use the parent unit's box build to validate the child unit. Specify to override the box build and validate the child unit against this part number instead.

parameters.name: checkRevision
parameters.description: Leave blank to use the parent unit's box build to validate the child unit. Specify along with {checkPartNumber} to override the box build and validate the child unit against this revision instead.

get.summary: Verify that the direct child units of the parent unit are correct according to the box build.
get.description:
Verify that the direct child units of the parent unit are correct according to the box build, including:
- That the child unit is set to the correct phase, by default Finalized, or the phase specified in the unit's ProductRevision's PhaseFinalized tag.
- That the child unit matches the box build part number, revision or revision mask, and quantity.

parameters.name: parentSerialNumber
parameters.description: The serial number of the parent unit.

parameters.name: parentPartNumber
parameters.description: The part number of the parent unit. Optional if you ensure units have unique serial numbers across all products.

post.summary: Removes the parent/child relation between two units. The parent/child relation must already exist.

parameters.name: parentSerialNumber
parameters.description: The serial number of the parent unit.

parameters.name: parentPartNumber
parameters.description: The part number of the parent unit. Optional if you ensure units have unique serial numbers across all products.

parameters.name: childSerialNumber
parameters.description: The serial number of the child unit that will be removed.

parameters.name: childPartNumber
parameters.description: The part number of the child unit that will be removed. Optional if you ensure units have unique serial numbers across all products.

parameters.description: If true, will only take continuous serial numbers with no gaps. Will fail if there are no sequences long enough.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format the taken serial numbers are returned in. Either XML or CSV.

get.summary: Gets the serial number types

put.description:
Set a unit's current phase.

Phases: 
- 1: "Unknown unit phase"
- 2: "Unit is under production"
- 4: "Unit is being repaired"
- 8: "Unit is being repaired for service (RMA)"
- 16: "Unit is finalized"
- 32: "Unit is scrapped"
- 64: "Unit is under extended test"
- 128: "Unit is under customization"
- 256: "Unit has been repaired"
- 512: "Unit is marked as missing"
- 1024: "Unit is in store (warehouse)"
- 2048: "Unit is shipped (out of factory)"
- 4098: "Unit is under production in a queue"
- 4100: "Unit is waiting for production repair"
- 4104: "Unit is waiting for service repair (RMA)"

parameters.name: serialNumber
parameters.description: Serial number

parameters.name: partNumber
parameters.description: Part number

parameters.name: phase
parameters.description: Current phase

get.description: Returns information about a unit and sub-units.

parameters.name: serialNumber
parameters.description: Serial number

parameters.name: partNumber
parameters.description: Part number (optional)

parameters.description: The max number of changes to return.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the change to delete.

For use with ERP intergration. Add or update revisions of products.

get.summary: Get an attachment from a report using either attachmentId or stepId.

parameters.name: reportId
parameters.description: Id of the report.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: For repair report, id of the attachment. Called BinaryDataGUID in WSXF and id in WSJF reports, on BinaryData element.

parameters.name: stepId
parameters.description: For test report, stepId of the attachment. Called Id in WSXF and id in WJSF reports, on Step element.

get.summary: Returns all attachments connected to a report as a zip archive

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Report Id

get.summary: Returns a list of most recent reports matching the specified filter.
get.description:
The Query action supports OData query options for filtering and paging. 
            
It supports:
- $filter: string functions, and/or/not logic operators, and eq/ne/gt/ge/lt/le/in comparison operators
- $top: max 10000 (use paging with $skip to get more over multiple queries)
- $orderby: only start, uuid, serialNumber, and timestamp
- $skip
- $select
- $expand

It does not support:
- $filter:  arithmetic, number, and date functions, arithmetic operators and 'has' logic operator
- $count
            
By default top 10 reports are returned and they are ordered by report start date/time (most recent first).
            

Examples:

Restrict to a specified part number:

https://your-server-address/api/report/query/header?$filter=partNumber eq 'XYZ123'

         
Top 1 reports ordered by start filtered by a specified serial number and part number:

https://your-server-address/api/report/query/header?$top=1&$orderby=start desc&$filter=serialNumber eq '123-45678' and partNumber eq 'XYZ123'


Get reports filtered by serial number, with all available expanded data:

https://your-server-address/api/report/query/header?$filter=serialNumber eq 'XY123'&$expand=subunits,miscinfo,assets,attachments,uurSubUnits,uurMiscInfo,uurAttachments

get.summary: Get report header data by searching for misc information

parameters.name: processCode
parameters.description: Report's process code

parameters.name: serialNumber
parameters.description: Report serial number

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Misc info description value

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Misc info data value

post.summary: Post a new WSJF report.

get.summary: Return a report in WSJF (Wats Standard JSON Format).
get.description: See Details about the WSJF format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique id (uuid/guid) of a WATS Report. This id can be found using the HeaderQuery method.

parameters.name: detailLevel
parameters.description:
The level of detail of the requested report.
            
            Level is an integer from 0-7 where 0 is report identifying data and 7 is full report.

parameters.name: includeChartdata
parameters.description: Specify if chart data (plots) should be included in the report, default is true. Specify false to suppress plot data for detail levels 6.

parameters.name: includeAttachments
parameters.description: Specify if attachment data should be included in the report, default is true. Specify false to suppress attachment data for detail levels 4-7.

post.summary: Post a new WSXF report.

get.summary: Return a report in WSXF (Wats Standard Xml Format)
get.description: See Details about the WSXF format

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique id (uuid/guid) of a WATS Report. This id can be found using the HeaderQuery method.

parameters.name: detailLevel
parameters.description:
The level of detail of the requested report
            
            Level is an integer from 0-7 where 0 is report identifying data and 7 is full report.

parameters.name: includeAttachments
parameters.description: Specify if attachment data should be included in the report, default to true. Specify false to suppress attachment data for detail levels 4-7.

parameters.name: includeChartdata
parameters.description: Specify if chart data (plots) should be included in the report, default to true. Specify false to suppress plot data for detail levels 6.

parameters.name: includeIndexes
parameters.description: Specify if indexes should be included in the report, default to true. Specify false to suppress indexes.

get.summary:
Creates a Json Web Token to be used with automatic provisioning from Azure. 
Provided with duration, you can specify the amount of days until the token expires and will need to have a new one generated.
The default duration is set to 90 days.
get.description:
Due to security reasons, we recommend leaving the duration to default. If you still wish
to increase the duration, you do so at your own risk.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Specifies a duration until the token expires. Measured in days.

get.summary: Gets a list of all users.

post.summary: Creates a new user using the provided user information in JSON format.

get.summary: Gets the user associated with the provided id.

delete.summary: Deletes a single user using userId.

patch.summary:
Updates user details for the provided username using JSON following the SCIM protocol.
Has to be in a SCIM patchOp format with schema.
Only "replace" is supported and value has to be either a string or boolean, depending on their original data type.
patch.description:
See https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7644#section-3.5.2 for more details.

Currently accepted path values are: fullName, familyName, givenName, roles, email, active, levels, productGroups.

levels and productGroups are a multi-value string with ';' as a separator. levels and productGroups will only add new restrictions.

active is a boolean and will de-activate the user in WATS if updated to false.

fullName, familyName, givenName, roles and email are a single-value string. Roles will throw an error if role cannot be found

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the user to update.

requestBody.description: A patchOp object following the SCIM standard.

get.summary: Gets a user using the provided user name.

post.summary: Create a new Package in Draft. If name exists, version will be previous version + 1.
post.description: Rules for Tags: Key-value pair of tags in a list. Formatted like [{ "key": "keyname", "value": "myValue"}]. Examples: [{"key": "Test_Tag","value": "TestValue"}], [{"key": "Test_Tag","value": "TestValue"}, {"key": "Test_Tag2", "value": "NewTestValue"}]

requestBody.description: The Package you want to create. Required values are: Name. Optional values are: Description, VirtualFolderId, installOnRoot, Priority, Tags

get.summary: Gets the specified Software Package by providing the ID of the package.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Software Package

put.summary:
Puts a Package. Note: This will overwrite existing configuration. Use POST api/Software/Package for new package versions.
Package in Draft allows for editing of all details. If package is Pending or Released, only Status and Tags can be edited.
Status follows these validation rules: Draft to Pending, Pending to Draft OR Released, Released to Revoked. 
Tags has to be in this format: <PackageInfo><tagName>TagValue</tagName><tagName2>TagValue2</tagName2></PackageInfo>.
put.description: Will overwrite any existing data for this Package with the new data.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Software Package

requestBody.description: The Package model with updated data.

delete.summary: Deletes the Software Package. Status of Software Package has to be Draft or Revoked before being deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Id of the Software Package

post.summary: Updates the file attribute for the specified file. Get file ID by calling /api/Software/GetPackageFiles/{id}

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of file to update attribute for.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: The attribute to add to file. All values are case insensitive. Accepted values: None, ExecuteOnce, ExecuteAlways, TopLevelFile, OverwriteNever, OverwriteOnNewPackageVersion, ExecuteOncePerVersion

post.summary:
Post a single Zip file to upload files into Software Package. Will merge files by default, provide query cleanInstall=true to delete all files and folders before installing.
Zip cannot contain files on root. All files need to be in folder otherwise; zipFile/myFolder/myFile.txt.
Zip has to be encoded using "multipart/form-data", and has to have content-type "application/zip".

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Software Package.

parameters.name: cleanInstall
parameters.description: Will remove ALL existing files and folders for this package before installing. Default is false.

get.summary: Searches for the Software Package with the provided name and status. Can also return a specific version.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Software Package

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Supported values: Draft, Pending, Released, Revoked

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: If not present in request, the highest version available will be returned

delete.summary: Deletes the Software Package by using name and version. Status of Software Package has to be Draft or Revoked before being deleted.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Software Package

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version you want to delete

get.summary: Returns a list of files assigned to Software Package. Note: Does not contain the actual files.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the package to fetch files from

get.summary: Returns a list with all Software Packages.
Filters for Software Packages with the provided tag and tag value and status.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Formatted like "tagName=tagValue" for the tag you want to filter for. Example: "Test_Tag=TestValue". tagName is case sensitive, tagValue is not.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Supported values: Draft, Pending, Released, Revoked

200.description: Returns the Packages using this tag

post.summary:
Updates the status of the Software Package defined by ID. 
Status can only go from Draft to Pending, Pending to Draft OR Released, and Released to Revoked. Any other configuration will be refused.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Software Package

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Supported values: Draft, Pending, Released, Revoked. Status can only go in certain patterns.

displayName, location, purpose and clientGroupId.

Returns a list of all clients/levels in your system with information like
name, type, status, version, last report, pending count etc.

Get level by hierarchy. 
Each element in sequence must map to a level in the system manager hierarchy. 
Topmost level specified in first position.

Returns: Leaf-level's id or null if the hierarchy is missing.

Please note: this endpoint doesn't work for level restricted users.

post.summary:
Post level by hierarchy. 
Each element in sequence will create a level in the system manager hierarchy. 
Topmost level specified in first position.

Please note: this endpoint doesn't work for level restricted users.

get.summary: Retrive system status
End workflow test activity
get.description:
• Unit must exist in WATS MES
  • Workflow must be initialized on the unit before use (e.g. via Operator Interface or WATS MES API) with same status (see 'status' parameter)
  • Current activity type in the unit's workflow must equal to 'Test', or else 'false' will be returned by the method

parameters.name: serialNumber
parameters.description: Unit serial number

parameters.name: partNumber
parameters.description: Unit part number

parameters.name: passed
parameters.description:
True = Passed (default value)
False = Failed

parameters.name: operatorName
parameters.description: Name of operator

parameters.name: stationName
parameters.description: Name of station

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Status of workflow definition
0 = Draft
1 = Pending
2 = Released (default value)
3 = Revoked

200.description: Returns boolean: 'true' if test ended successfully, otherwise 'false'

get.summary: Start workflow test activity
get.description:
• Unit must exist in WATS MES
  • Workflow must be initialized on the unit before use (e.g. via Operator Interface or WATS MES API) with same status (see 'status' parameter)
  • Current activity type in the unit's workflow must equal to 'Test', or else 'false' will be returned by the method

parameters.name: serialNumber
parameters.description: Unit serial number

parameters.name: partNumber
parameters.description: Unit part number

parameters.name: operatorName
parameters.description: Name of operator

parameters.name: stationName
parameters.description: Name of test station

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Status of workflow definition
0 = Draft
1 = Pending
2 = Released (default value)
3 = Revoked

200.description: Returns boolean: 'true' if test started successfully, otherwise 'false'

Virinco.WATS.Web.Dashboard.Controllers.a.description: Supported filters: productGroup, level, periodCount, grouping, includeCurrentPeriod, topCount, minCount.
Wats filter exposed in rest API

xmlData.description: Use an XPath to filter by tags. Only supports the 'eq' operator. Returns as an XML string.

runningCountLimit.description: Max count until next calibration must be performed (interval)

maintenanceInterval.description: Interval for maintenance (in days e.g 1.0 or 1.5)

calibrationInterval.description: Interval for calibration (in days e.g 1.0 or 1.5)

typeId.description: Type ID, Rowguid for SQL replication

runningCountLimit.description: Max count until next calibration must be performed (interval)

maintenanceInterval.description: Interval for maintenance (in days e.g 1.0 or 1.5)

calibrationInterval.description: Interval for calibration (in days e.g 1.0 or 1.5)

serialNumber.description: The RegEx pattern find the serial number.

partNumber.description: The RegEx pattern find the part number.

revision.description: The RegEx pattern find the revision.

batchNumber.description: The RegEx pattern find the batch number.

process.description: The RegEx pattern find the process code.

order.description: The order the identifiers are checked. An identifier with Order = 1 is checked before an identifier with Order = 2.

description.description: Text description of the identifier, typically an example of what the barcode looks like.

nonSerial.description: Flag indicating if the product can have units.

state.description: State. Can be Active (1) or Inactive(0)

productCategoryId.description: ID of category this product belongs to

revisions.description: List of revisions of this product

productId.description: ID of the product this revision belongs to

revision.description: Revision name, for example revision number or revision version

state.description: Revision state. Can be Active(1) or Inactive(0)

allProcessesExecutedInCorrectOrder.description: Unit was tested in correct process order according to process index.

allProcessesPassedFirstRun.description: Unit passed in each process first time.

allProcessesPassedAnyRun.description: Unit passed at some point in each process, maybe after or before fail and repair.

allProcessesPassedLastRun.description: Unit eventually passed in each process, maybe after fail and repair. See {Virinco.WATS.Web.Dashboard.Models.PublicUnitVerification.NonPassedCount} and {Virinco.WATS.Web.Dashboard.Models.PublicUnitVerification.RepairCount} per process.

results.description: Unit results per process in verification rule.

status.description: Unit test status in this process.

startUtc.description: Test start date and time, or null if {Virinco.WATS.Web.Dashboard.Models.PublicUnitVerification.StatusText} is 'Unknown'.

totalCount.description: How many times the unit was tested.

nonPassedCount.description: How many times the unit didn't pass the test.

repairCount.description: How many times the unit was repaired.

uuid.description: Report id. Can be used in order by

serialNumber.description: Report serial number. Can be using in order by

start.description: Report start time. In format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ. Default order by descending

result.description: Report result. Passed, Failed, Error, or Terminated

timeStamp.description: Report processing order. Does not represent time, instead is an incrementing number used as processing order. Can be used in order by

run.description: Report test run number (same serial number in same test operation)

causedUutFailure.description: Step name that caused the report to fail

causedUutFailurePath.description: Step path that caused the report to fail

passedInRun.description: Run number the report first passed in

referencedUut.description: Repair report referencing a test report

subUnits.description: UUT sub units. Must be expanded

miscInfo.description: UUT miscellaneous info. Must be expanded

assets.description: UUT asset info. Must be expanded

uurSubUnits.description: UUR sub units. Must be expanded

uurMiscInfo.description: UUR miscellaneous info. Must be expanded

runningCount.description: Asset running count when report was processed

runningCountExceeded.description: Asset running count limit execeeded by when report was processed

totalCount.description: Asset total count when report was processed

totalCountExceeded.description: Asset total count limit execeeded when report was processed

daysSinceMaintenance.description: Days since previous asset maintenance when report was processed

maintenanceDaysOverdue.description: Days overdue asset maintenance limit when report was processed

daysSinceCalibration.description: Days since previous asset calibration when report was processed

calibrationDaysOverdue.description: Days overdue asset calibration limit when report was processed

stepId.description: Id of step the attachment belongs to. Use in get attachment rest API to get attachment data.

id.description: Attachment id. Use in get attachment rest API to get attachment data.

Report_ID.description: Legacy Report_ID field. Needed to support 5.0.388 client in submitpendingreports

updateType.description:
0 = Ticket content (text)
1 = Progress changed
2 = Ticket properties (assignee, status, etc.)
3 = Notification info (reminder/mail)
